intro: Bolelia pulchella f. atrocinerea, commonly known as the dark-stemmed beauty, is a rare and striking plant species characterized by its deep purple stems and vibrant green leaves. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is native to specific regions in southern Europe. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in rocky or woodland habitats. Due to its limited distribution and unique appearance, it is considered a botanically significant and ecologically valuable species.
